ovdesc.p: This table will hold different types of outcomes: some are used to stamp the item (customer) in the queue for information only; others cause a re-queuing action (change priority in the same queue or transfer to another queue).
Outcome can be productive or non-productive.

desc.p: Whether the outcome is productive or not indicator.
Control queue type or queue for which this outcome code is available.
(Y/N) flag to indicate whether a date is to be entered with the outcome code.
Maximum number of days that can be between today date and the outcome due date.
(Y/N) flag to indicate whether an amount is to be entered with the outcome code.
To transfer an item from a queue to another queue based on the outcome code, the source queue should be specified in this field,
the destination queue is specified in the next field.
Destination queue for items stamped with the current outcome code.
Notes to be displayed when the collector enters the output code.
This is a FLAG used to enable the Reassigning of collector (Y/N).
This is a FLAG used to enable the Reassigning of QUEUE (Y/N).
